Package utils.expressions

Class Expression

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.expressions.Expression
  • public class Expression
extends java.lang.Object
    Expression
    Represents an evaluable arithmetic expression.

      • simple

        public void simple()
        Simplify the cases : (x - 0) = x, (x + 0) = x, (x * 1) = x, (x / 1) = x and (0 + x) = x, (1 * x) = x

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf()
        Check whether the expression if a leaf or not.
        Returns:
        true if the expression is a leaf, false otherwise.

      • changeSign

        public void changeSign()
        Change the sign of the operator. + => - and - => +. This is used because of the binary property. Basically, x - y + z is parsed to x - (y + z), which gives x - y - z instead of x - y + z. The solution is to switch the sign. x - y + z => x - (y - z).

      • nVar

        public int nVar()
        Get the number of variable is the tree
        Returns:
        Number of variable in the tree

      • lastVariable

        public int lastVariable()
        Get the last variable appearing in the expression. That is, the variable with the greatest index.
        Returns:
        The variable with the greatest index.

      • greaterOperator

        public boolean greaterOperator()
        Check if the expression contains a greater operator (or greater or equal)
        Returns:
        True if the operator is > or >=

      • lessOperator

        public boolean lessOperator()
        Check if the expression contains a less operator (or less or equal)
        Returns:
        True if the operator is < or <=

      • equalityOperator

        public boolean equalityOperator()
        Check if the expression contains an equality (or different)
        Returns:
        True if the operator is = or !=.

      • getBinding

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getBinding()
        Get the bindings of variables

        The bindings of variables

      • eval

        public boolean eval​(MapOf<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> values)
        Evaluate if the condition is satisfied given the values of the variables.
        Parameters:
        values - Values of the variables
        Returns:
        true if the condition is satisfied, false otherwise.
